text: How can I access multiple values of a dictionary using a tuple of keys?

elements.text: How can I access multiple values of a dictionary using a tuple of keys?

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

I found this post on Discourse, but it doesn't seem to work in Julia 1.5
<https://discourse.julialang.org/t/accessing-multiple-values-of-a-dictionary/8648/2>

attachments.title: Accessing multiple values of a dictionary
attachments.text: There are two fairly compelling potential meanings of x.[y]. It’s not yet clear which one is a better choice, and we’re not really considering adding new features until 1.0 is well out the door.
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: Accessing multiple values of a dictionary

elements.text: I found this post on Discourse, but it doesn't seem to work in Julia 1.5

text: Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56868| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

I'd just broadcast `getindex`:
```julia> d = Dict(:a => 1, :b => 2, :c => 3)
Dict{Symbol,Int64} with 3 entries:
  :a => 1
  :b => 2
  :c => 3

julia> getindex.(Ref(d), (:a, :b, :c))
(1, 2, 3)```

elements.text:
julia> d = Dict(:a => 1, :b => 2, :c => 3)
Dict{Symbol,Int64} with 3 entries:
  :a => 1
  :b => 2
  :c => 3

julia> getindex.(Ref(d), (:a, :b, :c))
(1, 2, 3)

text: Ahh thanks. The `Ref(...)` does the trick.
Hey <@UEA5FBCRH>, if you were able to find an answer here on Slack, please cross post it to Discourse via the link above. Thank you!
